trial_identification.studytitle: Comparing the Effects of Aerobic Exercise and Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare) on Pre-menstrual Syndrome in High School Young Girls
trial_identification.scientifictitle: effectiveness of Fennel and Aerobic Exercise each or together on Pre-menstrual Syndrome (PMS) on Young Girls Aged 16-18

conditions.healthcondition: pre-menstrual syndrome (PMS) symptoms such as irritability

interventions.interventions:
ARM 1: use of Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare) as a herbal medicine ,the amount of the given fennel extracts was 30 drops, every 8 hours, every day from 3 days before until 3 days after the onset of menstrual bleeding
ARM2: use of regular Aerobic exercise ,60 minutes ,3 time a week, every other day, 8 weeks, the exercise was 1 hour, include 15 minutes warming(Stretching Exercises), 15 minutes aerobic exercise,15 minutes running and 15 minutes Smooth running for ending ,the aim of this exercise is to gain Required heart rate (MHR) and for this ,first and second weeks our exercise pressure was 50% of maximum hart rat and third and fourth weeks 60%,fifth and sixth weeks 70% and two last weeks 80% of maximum heart rate. and they have supervised by a trained sport physiologist.
interventions.comparator: ARM3:Our control group didnt receive Fennel Extract and Aerobic Exercise but they have the same problem as other groups have

primaryOutcome.outcome: PMS symptom reduced as assessed by Daily Record of Severity of Problem (DRSP)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 days before until 3 days after the onset of menstrual bleeding (daily)
menstrual before the intervention and 2 menstrual cycle after intervention .(daily)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: depression and pain during menstrual as assessed by Daily Record of Severity of Problem (DRSP)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 200 students were requested to fill pre-menstrual recognition form (Aganov)and then 36 students with moderate to severe PMS were selected
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: in case of physical problem to do Aerobic exercise for exercise group or digestive problem or any allergy to Fennel extract for Fennel group

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Data was analyzed by SPSS (v. 11.5) and p<0.05 was considered statistically significant

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: no 11 Karobi Alley, norallah pazoki street,shohadaye gomnam square . Pakdasht city,Tehran,Iran postcode :3391915486

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Moalem High School . Pakdasht city,Tehran,Iran postcode:3391616813

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: no 17,Navabe Safavi Street, Garmsar, Semnan , Iran postcode: 3581777535

ethicsAndSummary.summary: the purpose of this study is to evaluated whether herbal medicine such as Fennel and aerobic exercise could reduce the severity of PMS symptom or not
